title_sort: louisa van velsor whitman to walt whitman, [19 march?–14 may? 1871]
title: Louisa Van Velsor Whitman to Walt Whitman, [19 March?–14 May? 1871]
text: 3 april 1871sundaySundayMy dear waltWalti write a few lines this beautifullbeautiful morning to tell you our georgeyGeorgey and wife didentdidn't come yesterday i got a letter from him after i had fixed for them saying they would come next saturdaySaturday i was sorry they didentdidn't come as i made some preperationspreparations for them) but perhaps itsit's all for the best as i shall get a little rested i hope before that time as we are up side down as the mans is about moving i dontdon't regret their going at all i shall try to get that room cleaned this coming week and get the bed in so maybeemaybe itsit's for the best they didintdidn't come only i made more preperationspreparations than i should have done if i had known they wouldentwouldn't have comei am pretty lame have had quite a seigesiege the last month or so) you will come home before long wontwon't you walterWalter deari wish waltWalt you would send my money order as soon as you conveintlyconveniently can any time this week will doodo walterWalter dearyour mother Louisa Van Velsor Whitman to Walt Whitman, [19 March?–14 May? 1871]
